"It's incredible that he received a red card." Mauricio Pochettino did not let up after the match. In the match between Everton and Tottenham yesterday (1-1), on the occasion of the 11th day of the Premier League, the coach of the Spurs saw his player Heung-Min Son sent off following a defensive tackle missed on the Toffees Andr√© Gomes, seriously injured on the action. The Portuguese suffers, after examination, a fracture-dislocation of the right ankle. In view of the pain and condition of the player's ankle at the moment, referee Martin Aktinson chose to release a red card while he had, at first, sanctioned South Korean a yellow card.




"A very confusing situation"




Heung-Min Son, shocked by the serious injury of Andre Gomes + 11 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

"It was a very confusing situation, it was difficult to keep calm, afterwards when you watch the action on TV, you see that it was never his intention to hurt through this tackle," defended Mauricio Pochettino, before attacking the VAR: "In this type of situation, it changed the game because the yellow card has turned into a red card, which has created disorder." There are many examples It was very hard and completely unfair to Son and Tottenham, it's a very difficult situation to understand. "
Heung-Min Son's teammates also stepped in to defend their teammate, including Dele Alli, a decisive scorer for Londoners. "I went into the locker room and Son is devastated, he's crying but it's not his fault, he's one of the kindest people you'll ever meet, he would not have wanted to do something like that, "said the Englishman at the microphone of Sky Sports.
